comments:
Creation of manual or jUnitTestCase is throwing StringIndexOutOfBoundsException.
Which can be noticed if you look at the .log file from the workspace after 
creation of Testcase.

Steps:
         Create a manual/jUnit TestCase and add some testcases.
         Save this testcases. 
     Note: When I created a Testcase, I gave a name like record a script 
(Spaces exist).

Additonal notes:
   The steps mentioned in the defect is not exactly the same. See the new steps 
to reproduce the defect.
       Add a new testcase
       When you get the default testcase name, use backspace and remove all 
       characthers, and continue to press back space couple more times even 
       after all the characters are cleared.
 now you can see the log is being created.

I cannot reproduce it as Vinod stated. However, I found the same exception when:
1. In a JUnit/Manual test suite, add a new test case in the editor.
2. On the "Test Cases" editor, modify the name in "General Information" to be empty.
3. Save the test suite.

Fixed the error that when trimmed string is empty should just return it.
